author: Staff Reporter
text:
: Members of the Tamizhaga Vivasaigal Sangam, Vellore, observed a token fast at Pernambut on Wednesday demanding measures from the Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board to prevent tanneries and glue factories from polluting water.

S. Udayakumar, the association’s district secretary (west), said there were several glue factories in Pernambut, and these factories were polluting water sources owing to discharge of chemical effluents.

“The factories are located in various parts of Pernambut such as Kothur and near Pernambut Eri. Ground water has been badly polluted by these factories,” he said. The farmers urged the TNPCB to take steps to prevent pollution by glue factories and tanneries.
title: Farmers seek action against polluting factories
